288.heading: Schnapp, Ira.
288.title: Superman : Sunday Pages : 1943-1946
288.author: scripts by Jerry Siegel and DC Comics ; artwork by Wayne Boring and Jack Burnley ; lettering by Ira Schnapp ; edited and designed by Dean Mullaney.
notes: (The Library of American Comics)
Other title: Superman: the Golden Age Sundays, 1943-1946.
Continues where the 1998 Kitchen Sink Press volume left off, with the 184th Sunday strip.

"Although no records have been uncovered that specify which stories were written by Siegel, a reading of the text reveal hallmarks of his style in all stories except the "Superman's Service to Servicemen" sequence, which corresponds to his induction into the army on July 4, 1943."
Includes an introduction by Mark Waid.

"The strips reprinted in this volume were produced in a time when racial and social caricatures played a larger role in society and popular culture. They are reprinted without alteration for historical reference."
